animation

Class Breakpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • animation.Breakpoint

  • public class Breakpoint
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a breakpoint in the simulation. Breakpoints are used to pause a simulation when an attribute reaches a certain value.
    Author:
    Nicolas Saumure

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Breakpoint(EntityIcon icon, java.lang.String attributeName, java.lang.String breakpointValue)
      Constructor of the breakpoint.

      Get the name of the icon containing the breakpoint.

      Set the value for which the simulation should stop once it is reached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Breakpoint

        public Breakpoint(EntityIcon icon,
                  java.lang.String attributeName,
                  java.lang.String breakpointValue)
        Constructor of the breakpoint. The value is updated to be displayed in the table.
        Parameters:
        icon - Reference to the EntityIcon creating a breakpoint
        attributeName - Name of the attribute creating a breakpoint
        breakpointValue - The value for which the attribute should pause the simulation.

    • Method Detail

      • updateCurrentValue

        public boolean updateCurrentValue()
        Compares the current value to the new value for the attribute. If the new value is different the current value is updated.
        Returns:
        True if the value was updated.

      • getIconName

        public java.lang.String getIconName()
        Get the name of the icon containing the breakpoint.
        Returns:
        String containing the name.

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.String getAttribute()
        Get the name of the attribute creating a breakpoint.
        Returns:
        String containing the name.

      • getCurrentValue

        public java.lang.String getCurrentValue()
        Get the current value of the attribute.
        Returns:
        String containing the value.

      • getBreakpointValue

        public java.lang.String getBreakpointValue()
        get the value for which the attribute will pause the simulation
        Returns:
        String containing the value

      • setBreakpointValue

        public void setBreakpointValue(java.lang.String breakpointValue)
        Set the value for which the simulation should stop once it is reached.
        Parameters:
        breakpointValue -

      • checkbreakpoint

        public boolean checkbreakpoint()
        Check if the current value is equal to the breakpoint value. If the value is a Double we need to convert both value in doubles for round numbers. (2 = 2.0) Otherwise we can compare their String value.
        Returns:
        True if the values are equal and the breakpoint should pause the simulation.
